summary: I love the idea of Tony coming out as bi sometime right before Steve comes out of the ice and so when he gets out he watches the...
body: I love the idea of Tony coming out as bi sometime right before Steve comes out of the ice and so when he gets out he watches the press conference on YouTube and it helps him come to terms with his sexuality which is why he’s so distraught in winter soldier bc he’s starting to understand his feelings for bucky and listen I’m a disaster gay and so are all the avengers I don’t make the rules

blog.name: voicemailsfrompeterparker
blog.title: Voicemails From Peter Parker
blog.description:
A collection of voicemail transcriptions from Peter Parker to Tony Stark.
Documented by F.R.I.D.A.Y and @foxbowl (updates every Friday). 

Click here to see Peter's voicemails in chronological order!
Request for a voicemail and F.R.I.D.A.Y. will try to find it in her archives ↓

summary: ————————————————————— Voicemail #19 To: Tony Stark From: Peter Parker Hey, um, Mr. Stark? You know that message I left about…...
body:
—————————————————————

Voicemail #19

To: Tony Stark

From: Peter Parker

Hey, um, Mr. Stark? You know that message I left about… about thirty seconds ago? Y’know, where I was asking for advice on, uh, on crushes and stuff. Well, um… would you, like, please- please just forget about it. I don’t know why I asked a bazillionaire about that. That was super uncool, so, uh, just tell your Karen-lady to delete it and forget I ever sent a message. Okay? Uh, thanks, Mr. Stark, I’ll send you a report about me saving people and punching things soon.

—————————————————————

Uh, thanks, Mr. Stark, I’ll send you a report about me saving people and punching things soon.

blog.name: steverogersisabitch
blog.title: Steve Is A Bitch
blog.description: if ur hating on my boy tony, then ur fucking wrong lol (and ur abt to catch these mother fucking hands)

summary: Why I don’t like most heros besides Dr. Tony Stark:
body:
Why I don’t like most heros besides Dr. Tony Stark:

When speaking about heros their strength really comes down to what powers they have.

With the MCU Maximoff twins, they weren’t really anything before they volenteered to be experimented on by hydra and got their powers. They were never shown without their abilities.

The same goes for other heros. We see Steve Rogers before he gets the supersoldier serum, but he’s really nothing before he gets it. People may argue, “but he’s courageous?” Or “he represents the little guy!”. He represents false hope. In the real world there isn’t a serum that can fix every health issue you have. He may have the will but Captain America essientially says that you must be changed to make change happen.

Tony Stark is different. Tony Stark never had powers or abilities handed to him. He grew up wealthy but when he was given Stark Industries it was a weapon company and he changed that.

Tony Stark is an example, a beautiful one. Steve Rogers might have a huge, buff body, but Tony Stark has his mind. That dies when he does. The arc reactor doesn’t make him stronger, it actually breaks him down, it causes him pain. But he continues to improve, he fixes things, broadens his education, and learns from his mistakes. HE MAKES MISTAKES, I’m not one someone would think could say that, but he does and I love him even more for it.

When the next avengers movie comes out if Steve Rogers dies he will leave behind war stories and a dirty combat suit designed by Tony Stark. If Tony Dies, the world will miss out on millions of creations and ideas that could save people, the earth, and other planets. The world’s tech WILL fall behind, and who will take his place, he has shoes that NO ONE can fill.

If Steve dies, Tony is strong enough and smart enough to protect the world and lead the avengers. But if Tony dies, the world’s future will die with it.

summary: seeing the world through your eyes
title: seeing the world through your eyes
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2D5ouTz

by itsallAvengers

Sometimes Tony does things that Steve doesn’t really understand. Turns out, there’s a reason for that. But it’s not really one that Steve is all too aware of, what with him being from the forties and all. Back then, they would’ve called it laziness.

Now, apparently, it’s ADHD.

Steve’s still got a lot to learn about the future. And his boyfriend. But never say Captain America isn’t up for the challenge.

Words: 9456, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

by itsallAvengers

Sometimes Tony does things that Steve doesn’t really understand. Turns out, there’s a reason for that. But it’s not really one that Steve is all too aware of, what with him being from the forties and all. Back then, they would’ve called it laziness.

Now, apparently, it’s ADHD.

Steve’s still got a lot to learn about the future. And his boyfriend. But never say Captain America isn’t up for the challenge.

Mobile Masterlist

question: Tony Stark and 33.
answer:
Your eyes ache with tiredness as you try to study for your upcoming exam. You yawn softly, feeling your head nod a bit forward before you jerk yourself upright to focus.

Ugh.

You turn the page of your textbook when you feel it.

The light brush of fingertips skimming your shoulder so delicately that it makes you shiver.

You lean backwards a bit to meet the solid warmth of your boyfriend. “I thought you were in a meeting.”

He chuckles. “Yeah, but my spidey senses were tingling that my girlfriend needed me.” He pauses. “I think that kid has been getting to me.”

You laugh softly. “I’ll make sure Peter knows.”

Tony chuckles again and the kisses your shoulder tenderly. “Come on, time for bed.”

You glance at your offending textbook and the open arms of your boyfriend. You smile, standing. “Sounds good.”

He grins. “That’s my girl.”
